channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Perl for High Performance; Senior Developer, West London
item.description: Do you know how to solve problems in terms of queues and caches? Does the idea of truly scaling your architecture on AWS excite you? Not fazed by designing your workloads to be distributed?

item.title: Do you love customers? Senior Perl Developer with a product focus, London
item.description: Ever find yourself wishing you could see meaningful impact on users from your work? Trapped in a company with long release cycles and dubious release dates? Wish your ideas for product improvement didnâ€™t keep disappearing in to the Project Managerâ€™s backlog?

item.title: Sponsorship opportunity available for mid-level or senior Perl developers in London
item.description: This is a friendly, dynamic team based in Canary Wharf and for the first time the company is offering visa sponsorship for the right candidate. If youâ€™ve got experience with Modern Perl this could be your opportunity to make the move to sunny London.

item.title: How to use Libraries.io data from millions of open source projects
item.description: An article about Libraries.io, a service that has data on language libraries, including CPAN and those from 32 other package managers. The data from this service is now available.

item.title: What is a "Senior Developer"?
item.description: Curtis presents his thoughts on what makes a developer a Senior developer.

item.title: EPO Hackathon
item.description: On Tuesday 8th August, the day before TPC::EU starts, there is going to be a hackathon in Amsterdam, to work on the EPO web sites. If you're going to be there for the conference, why not volunteer to help out.

item.title: Swiss Perl Workshop 2017 - Final Call For Papers
item.description: It's not long to the Swiss Perl Workshop (25th and 26th August), and this is your last chance to submit a talk proposal.

item.title: Perl 6 Fundamentals Now Available for Purchase
item.description: Moritz's book, Perl 6 Fundamentals, is now available!

item.title: 2017.29 Zoffix Released
item.description: The weekly roundup of Perl 6 news, which headlines with the news that Zoffix has stepped down as release manager, with Alex Daniel taking up the baton.

item.title: berrybrew, the Perlbrew for Windows, updated to v1.13
item.description: A new version of berrybrew has been released. This lets you have multiple versions of Perl installed on a Windows machine, and switch between them as your default Perl.

item.title: P5P Mailing List Summary: July 10th-16th
item.description: The weekly summary of news from P5P, the headline of which is the releases of 5.24.2 and 5.22.4.

item.title: PPIx-Regexp Perl Version Functionality
item.description: Tom introduces his PPIx::Regexp module, which provides a PPI-like interface for parsing regular expressions.

item.title: 1000th consecutive days releasing to CPAN
item.description: On Sunday 23rd July, Mohammad did a release to CPAN, making it the 1000th consecutive day that he'd done a CPAN release on. That's nearly 3 years (1095 days). In that time he's released a lot of his own modules, but has also got co-maint on a lot of others, and adopted some of those.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: Neo4j in your own software: Very basic Perl hacking
item.description: The third article in a series, this one shows how you can use the Neo4j graph database from Perl.

item.title: Reading/writing Arduino pins over I2C with Perl
item.description: Steve shows how to talk to an Arduino from Perl, over the I2C bus.

item.title: Drawing Traffic Lights With Perl
item.description: Dave needs images of traffic lights, for some secret squirrel project he's working on. He ended up creating SVG::TrafficLight, which makes it easy to draw SVG traffic lights.

item.title: #313 - 1000 days of CPAN releases.
item.description:
Mohammad Anwar has done at least one CPAN release per day for the last 1000 days, adopting a bunch of CPAN distributions along the way. His passion for help CPAN and CPAN authors, is admirable!

Check out the list of talks for TPC::EU, which has now been finalised. And if you're going to TPC::EU, you could help out the EPO, if you're going to be there the day before the conference proper starts.

Neil
item.dc:subject: list of tags?
